reviewText: The best actor in four of his greatest movies. I am a huge Bogie fan and this collection is great. My wife and I watch them over and over. Never get tired of seeing them especially when nothing is on that is interesting. It is a must have for any Bogie fan.
Not as great as I was expecting it to be. I love Humphrey Bogart, and the movies were enjoyable, an okay collection.

TCM and Warner keep on truckin' with these 4-great-films-for-cheap releases.  After buying some of the newer titles it appears they have officially abandoned their double-sided flipper discs and opted for reusing the original single-sided discs with same disc labels (BTW these collections are all re-releases, nothing new).  However they are housed in a stackable hub case which some people believe could scratch discs somehow.  I've never come across a disc that's been damaged in these cases so I much prefer it over the flipper discs.  With twice the discs (and subsequently the label artwork as well) it feels like you're getting just a little more for your money.

As for the films themselves, they are all quintessential classic cinema at it's finest.  While Bogie isn't the lead in 2 of them (The Petrified Forest, The Amazing Dr. Clitterhouse) he is fantastic in the smaller roles.  All of them boast phenomenal casts with the likes of Edward G. Robinson, Ida Lupino, Bette Davis, Jackie Gleason and Phil Silvers.  All Through the Night isn't really a gangster film but instead features Bogie as a good-natured kingpin gambler complete with a hilarious posse who uncovers an underground ring of Nazis - doesn't really fit in with the other movies but great stuff nonetheless.  All discs have some special features like Warner's "Night at the Movies" which presents you with a period-appropriate trailer, newsreel, short subject and cartoon just like you would have seen at the theater back then.

More 4-movie collections from TCM & Warner will most likely be on the way given the rate they are cranking them out now.  About 1/3 of the DVDs from their Warner Bros. Gangster Collections haven't yet been re-released in these moneysavers and they've got an incredible catalog of existing releases to pull from.  After passing on a lot of DVDs over the years, it's convenient to see some get a second life at a more economical rate.
Great movies
Great movie and great picture clarity.
I like TCM and the classics.
Great movie collection from the one and only Bogie!!!
Video is good but the audio is poor, can't get any volume.  You will be glad it has sub-titles.  Of course the stories are classic Bogey.

Turner Classics are definitely the way to go if you like vintage movies.  Their extras are just as engaging as the movies themselves.  The prints they use are always high quality.  Sound quality is also top notch.  All the films come with subtitles.  Before we started watching these movies we had only seen a few Bogart films.  It's easy to see why he has such a stellar reputation.  The actors, direction, and stories attached to these films are miles beyond what we see today.  About the only thing they do better now is special effects and even CG can be cheesy.
Loved the movies
one of the greatest actors ever.

Painted Desert and High Sierra are above average flics of that era.  The other two are OK entertainment, but totally unnoteworthy.  Desert and Sierra are desirable additions to a Bogart collection, displaying the range of his talent.  The stories are quite good, but the screenplay rather uninspired.  The car chase in Sierra was quite good, and thankfully did not have any of the now required flaming crashes.  As usual for this era, nobody knew how to handle a firearm.
I just needed them for my archives...
You can not beat Bogart. Enough said.

Enjoyed this 4 disc deal.
Especially enjoyed High Sierra.

4 great Bogie films, with only two where he was the lead ("All Through the Night" & "High Sierra"). Makes you wish each of the 4 would come out on Blu-ray..."All Through the Night" is both suspenseful and funny, with Jackie Gleason & Phil Silvers --some years before either were TV stars-- in bit roles...The true classics are "High Sierra" with Bogie as the doomed parolee out to make a final score and "The Petrified Forest" in which he made a gigantic impact as Duke Mantee, the Dillinger-like escapee who takes control of a desert cafe. Pretty much a must-have collection...
Great grouping of Bogart movies. Restored and superbly packaged with interesting and informative extra information added to the extras menu.
what could I ask for 4 great Humphrey Bogart movies
Bogart's ruthless gangster character in early development. Good films.
Well worth buying and staying in your library. Love the classics, partly because they hold our cultural history. Good stuff.
A must for all Bogart fans!
great movies great price

These are classic films, so I will not bore anyone with my reviews of each. The quality was excellent. Each film is on a separate disc. Since I store my DVDs in binder sleeves, this means I only have 1 empty disc case to discard. Although there was a redundant cardboard sleeve, the case contined no loose junk-advertising inside.
Bogart is awesome!!
As advertised, quick delivery

There are no new accolades one can add to the stellar career of one of our most beloved actors.  Humphrey Bogart is brilliant in almost every film he has ever been in and this collection is part of that legacy. There are no "throwaway" films in this set either..they are all solid Bogart performances.
Four Bogart movies from the 40's.
This is an economical way to get four classic movies.  If you are a Bogie fan, you'll want this.
Just what I expected! Nice
Great classic flicks. Enjoyed them all
Who doesn't love a good Bogart movie?  These are all excellent!  Thought a long time before purchasing, but glad I did!!

There is nothing more satisfying than a night of great Humphrey Bogart films. I just wish.they didn't pile all the discs on one spool The quality of the p prints was excellent, and the extras restrictions. Includingclassic WB cartoons.
Quality of audio and video is excellent. As far as content there is no such thing A bad bogy film.
Great collection of films!
TCM always good.  Bogart off the charts.  They don't make them like they used to.

I purchased this dvd set because I'm a big Humphrey Bogart fan. I love the movie High Sierra and Petrified Forest but All Through the Night has got to be the worst Humphrey Bogart movie I have ever seen!  I don't know why they included Amazing Dr. Clitterhouse in this package because the star of the movie is Edward G. Robinson not Humphrey Bogart. All in all you get three good movies and one piece of junk movie.
Only one film missing from this fabulous collection, and that is my favorite lesser known film THE LEFT HAND OF GOD, starring Bogart, Gene Tierney, Lee J. Cobb, E.G. Marshall and Agnes Moorehead.

This collection is okay at best. The majority of the films were made before Humphrey Bogart became a film force. For example, for two of the films in this collection, Bogart was a supporting player and wasn't the central character. High Sierra is worth the purchase price. If you consider the other film as just a bonus, you won't be disappointed. If you are looking for more, then I suggest considering another collection.
great quality prints and a few extras. hey, it's Bogey
This DVD was specified as being in colour. The DVDs delivered were in black and white. This is false advertising, and disappointing. Buyer beware.
bogie is the best!
Love these films,hate that volume needs to be cranked way up to hear. The best of the gangster films of their day.
Bogie is the best and for the price this collection is a steal.  If you love Bogart you have to have these.
Again, I have said it before Bogart was a Master at his craft and that talent is what makes his films memorable to generations of movie goers and film critics

Great collection of movies - Bogart, Edward G. Robinson, Claire Trevor, Bette Davis, Ida Lupino, Leslie Howard.  Includes three Warner Night at the Movies.  As usual with TCM collections, you get a lot of entertainment for the price.
Humphrey Bogart is excellent in all four of the films.  I was especially fond of "All Through the Night".  Bogey's portrayal of a gangster with a heart is excellent.

The one I had not seen and enjoyed the most was, as it turns out, his debut movie as a main character and where Bette Davis must have been 20 years old, if that!  These were not his best, or most famous roles and I can't say I'd highly recommend purchasing this group of four.  Although, High Sierras is always good. Unlike the Cagney Gangsters, where the group of four were all excellent, whoever made the selections for Bogart's movies should go back to the drawing board.

The petrified Forrest: while the main storyline was a romance, and bogie was a minor character, it was thoroughly enjoyable!
High Sierra: I loved it, kept me entertained! It was a simply delightful movie!
Dr. Clitterhouse: a good movie, weird premise but enjoyable.
All through the night: is a twisting plot involving nazis, sports betting and murder. Obviously filmed during World War Two.

The only thing I can say about this disk is that I wish it had four more movies . This set of movies are a perfect group of similar stories . A person forgets the acting quality of these people . Its great to be able to see them again
I enjoyed so much these film as Humphrey Bogart was a great favorite of mine for his acting and his dialogue with these films.
Todays Hollywood films are so fast paced, I wasn't sure how I would like these, but they are great.  Guess I didn't realize what a good actor Humphrey Bogart was.  This is a wonderful set.

Humphrey is at his best in Petrified Forest and High Sierra. These are earlier films before casablanca and after a lot of gangster early films, It shows the versatility and depth of acting Humphrey could do, such a talented actor.
Well worth the money.  Great films from the past. If you like Bogart, these are priceless! Classic films, great casts!
The price was excellent and it arrived very fast! It's a great collection of some hard to find Bogie films. 10/10!

Technical problem with one DVD. High Sierra did not play on my player. A replacement was sent and the same thing, with the same disc happened. Finally went to Walmart, brought the disk and SAME THING happened with it. There is a production problem at TCM with High Sierra. The other disks are great.
This was a great deal on a classic collection. I think it is a perfect way to add fine films to any collection.
I love classics.
